I've never quite understood, what's with the different apo- and peri- suffixes? For example, Apogee and perigee, aphelion and perihelion.

Does it differ in some sort of condition?

Sphere of Influence?
It's to do with the body they're relative to; Apogee-earth, Apohelion-sun, Apoapsis-generic term, et.c.
Ah, thanks! Mods may close this proof of stupidity now.

If I had to give a Greek name to Kerbin, it would be Hephaistos, the ugly god of forges, volcanoes and artisans. Cause my crafts are ugly as hell, require a lot of craftsmanship, and often in beautiful explosions with debris flying everywhere.
Hm. He was the guy that Prometheus stole the fire from, wasn't he? I don't think it'd fit. If I recall correctly, he strove for perfection in his works. Not very Kerbal of him.
